content.title: Pre-Battle Inspection
content.setup:
Battle tomorrow — maybe today. {LANCE_LEADER_SHORT} wants every blade sharp, every strap tight.

"Check everything, {PLAYER_NAME}. I don't want anyone dying because their buckle broke."

options.text: Thorough inspection, fix everything
Focus on weapons, they matter most
Quick check, trust the soldiers to maintain
Work through the night
options.outcome: You take the risk and see it through.

content.title: Broken Blade
content.setup:
{VETERAN_1_NAME} brings you a sword — snapped clean in half. Good steel, but it failed at the wrong moment.

"Can you fix it? It was my father's."

options.text: Reforge it properly (takes time)
Patch it — functional but not pretty
Explain it's beyond repair, offer alternative
Claim materials are short, refuse

content.title: Forge Fire
content.setup:
The field forge is temperamental today. Too hot, then too cold. The bellows need fixing and the coals are uneven.

Good steel needs good fire.

options.text: Take time to fix it properly
Work around it — adapt your technique
options.outcome: You take the risk and see it through.

options.text: Ask the local smith for help
Push through, accept imperfect results

content.title: Captured Arms
content.setup:
{ENEMY_FACTION_ADJECTIVE} weapons piled in the wagons. Some are better than what our soldiers carry.

{SECOND_SHORT} wants them sorted. "What's worth keeping? What do we melt down?"

options.text: Evaluate everything carefully
Keep the best, scrap the rest
Mark the best pieces for reforging
Set aside the finest piece for yourself
options.outcome: You do it, knowing it will have consequences.

content.title: Armor Fitting
content.setup:
{RECRUIT_NAME} got new armor — but it doesn't fit. Too loose in the shoulders, too tight at the waist.

"Can't fight in this. Feels like I'm wearing a barrel."

options.text: Adjust it properly — takes hours
Quick adjustments, good enough
Teach them to adjust it themselves
"Figure it out yourself"
